info.name: Pyramid
info.description: The pyramid is a large fiber bundle located on the medial and ventral aspect of the medulla. It consists of corticospinal (and some corticobulbar) fibers that originate in the ipsilateral cerebral cortex (precentral gyrus and elsewhere). These upper motor neuron fibers terminate on lower motor neurons in the ventral horn of the spinal cord (corticospinal) and on cranial nerve motor neurons in the medulla (corticobulbar). Often referred to as the pyramidal tract.
